page.title: 06Trade in Cattistock
page.content: Cattistock relies for its services on the following: Police - no police house, but regular visits from Dorchester; Telephones - one public call box and "pay-phone" in public house, 70% of population is served personally; Postal - daily deliveries and collections, except Sundays; Refuse - household collection weekly; Water - hard water area; Gas - none; Electricity - village connected to national supply; Sewage - most of village is on mains drainage, remainder of area relies on septic tanks; Library - mobile library visits fortnightly; Milk -- delivered daily, except Sundays; Eggs - local farmer's wife delivers weekly; Newspapers - daily deliveries, including Sundays; Stores and Post Office - self service store; Fishmonger - delivers 3 times a week.
